roleset.name: walk, be a pedestrian, forward motion, one foot in front of the other
roleset.note: WALK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'walk' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry run-51.3.2, other framed members include charge, climb, file, jump, leap, roll, run, etc. Comparison with 'run'. Arg1 seems to occur only rarely; DIR occurs most of the time. (from walk.01-v)
WALK-N NOTES: Added by Julia based loosly on walk-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls run-51.3.2. (from walk.01-n)

roles.note: Arg 2 is for underspecifed locations (e.g. "around the campus") or Paths realized as objects: "he walked a mile/the plank." For more semantically specific realizations of DIR and GOL, use the ARGM.

role.descr: entity being walked, where there is outside Agent

example.name: GOL as PP
example.text: When Mr. Jacobson walked into the office at 7:30 a.m. EDT, he announced: ``OK, buckle up.''

example.name: DIR as ADV
example.text: ``The buyers walk away, and the specialist is left alone'' as the buyer of last resort for his stable of stocks, he contends.

example.name: another ex of 'path'
example.text: Firms Walk Fine Line In Distributing Profits

example.name: with COM
example.text: Monica Sharp went out for a walk with her dog weeks ago

example.name: just arg2
example.text: @NASA says it may decide by tomorrow whether another space walk will be needed to fix torn thermal blanket that blew a cockpit window

example.name: Light Verb
example.text: "Those people who are always complaining about their lot in life should take a walk around a cancer ward , " Li says .
example.arg: Those people who are always complaining about their lot in life

example.name: just arg0
example.text: The normal walk of the dog can be encumbered by long toenails.

roleset.name: baseball, walk the batter in baseball
roleset.note: WALK-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on walk-v.02. No VNcls. (from walk.02-n)

roles.note: Pay close attention to whether the pitcher or the batter is the one doing the walking-- if you really can't tell, go with arg0. (from walk.02-v)

example.name: ERA
example.text: He gave up seven hits, walked five and didn't get a decision.

example.name: Batter as walker
example.text: He-1 smoked Toronto in the playoffs with six hits , seven walks and eight stolen bases in 22 at bats , and continued that by going 3 - for - 3 at the plate Sunday , along with *PRO*-1 walking , stealing a base and scoring a run .

example.name: just arg 1
example.text: Danielson facilitated the Waterford strategy by calling a time out to discuss an intentional walk of the batter, Alex Tuneski.

example.name: I have a headache THIS BIG
example.text: Sometimes, if you have a headache, you can go out and walk it right off.''
